description: A classic Canadian dish of french fries and cheese curds topped with a brown gravy.
preparation: 1. Make french fries. 2. Prepare a brown gravy. 3. Top hot fries with cheese curds and pour hot gravy over them to melt the cheese.

description: A sweeter, denser, and thinner bagel boiled in honey-sweetened water and baked in a wood-fired oven.
preparation: 1. Create the dough and let it rise. 2. Form bagels and boil them in honey water. 3. Coat with sesame seeds and bake until golden brown.

description: A small, sweet pastry tart with a filling of butter, sugar, syrup, and egg.
ingredients: ['Pastry dough', 'Brown sugar', 'Butter', 'Corn syrup', 'Egg', 'Vanilla extract', 'Raisins or pecans (optional)']
preparation: 1. Prepare pastry shells. 2. Mix filling ingredients and pour into shells. 3. Bake until filling is set and pastry is golden.

description: A sandwich consisting of a cooked patty of ground meat, usually beef, placed inside a sliced bun.
preparation: 1. Form ground beef into patties. 2. Grill or pan-fry patties to desired doneness. 3. Serve on a bun with desired toppings.

description: A pie in which the principal filling ingredient is apple, often spiced with cinnamon.
preparation: 1. Prepare pie crust. 2. Peel, core, and slice apples. 3. Mix apples with sugar and spices and place in crust. 4. Top with second crust, cut vents, and bake.

description: Pork or beef ribs slow-cooked and slathered in a tangy barbecue sauce.
preparation: 1. Create a dry rub and coat the ribs. 2. Slow cook in an oven or smoker until tender. 3. Brush with BBQ sauce and finish on the grill.

description: A rich, creamy soup containing clams and potatoes.
preparation: 1. Cook bacon and sauté onions and celery. 2. Add flour to make a roux. 3. Add clam juice, potatoes, and cook until tender. 4. Stir in cream and chopped clams.

description: A spicy stew from Louisiana, typically containing shellfish or meat, okra, and a roux.
preparation: 1. Make a dark roux with flour and oil. 2. Sauté vegetables (the 'holy trinity'). 3. Add stock, sausage, and simmer. 4. Add shrimp and okra near the end. Serve with rice.

description: A Louisiana Creole dish of Spanish and French influence, consisting of meat and vegetables mixed with rice.
preparation: 1. Brown the chicken and sausage. 2. Sauté vegetables. 3. Add rice, tomatoes, stock, and spices. 4. Simmer until rice is cooked, adding shrimp in the last few minutes.

description: Tacos made with spit-grilled pork, marinated in a blend of dried chilies, spices, and pineapple.
preparation: 1. Marinate pork. 2. Traditionally, cook on a vertical spit with a pineapple on top. 3. Shave off meat and serve on tortillas with pineapple, onion, and cilantro.

description: A rich, dark sauce made from chili peppers, fruits, nuts, and chocolate, often served over turkey or chicken.
preparation: 1. Toast and rehydrate chilies. 2. Fry and grind all sauce ingredients. 3. Simmer the sauce for a long time to develop flavors. 4. Serve over cooked chicken.

description: Poblano peppers stuffed with cheese or meat, coated in an egg batter, and fried.
preparation: 1. Roast and peel peppers. 2. Stuff with cheese. 3. Coat in flour and a whipped egg batter. 4. Fry until golden brown and serve with tomato sauce.

description: An avocado-based dip, spread, or salad first developed in Mexico.
preparation: 1. Mash ripe avocados. 2. Finely dice onion, tomatoes, cilantro, and jalapeño. 3. Mix all ingredients with lime juice and salt.

description: A seafood dish where raw fish is cured in citrus juices, such as lemon or lime, and spiced with chili peppers.
ingredients: ['Fresh white fish (like sea bass)', 'Lime juice', 'Red onion', 'Cilantro', 'Aji limo (chili pepper)', 'Salt']
preparation: 1. Cut fish into small cubes. 2. 'Cook' the fish in fresh lime juice for about 15 minutes. 3. Add thinly sliced onion, chopped cilantro, and chili. 4. Season with salt.

description: A popular Peruvian stir-fry that combines marinated strips of sirloin with onions, tomatoes, and french fries.
preparation: 1. Marinate beef strips. 2. Stir-fry beef at high heat. 3. Add onions and tomatoes. 4. Toss with french fries and serve immediately with rice.

description: A creamy Peruvian chicken stew made with aji amarillo peppers, cheese, and walnuts.
preparation: 1. Cook and shred chicken. 2. Make a sauce by blending soaked bread, aji paste, milk, cheese, and walnuts. 3. Combine shredded chicken with the sauce and simmer.

description: A rich stew of black beans with various cuts of pork and beef, considered Brazil's national dish.
preparation: 1. Soak beans and dried meats overnight. 2. Cook beans and meats together slowly for several hours until tender. 3. Sauté onions and garlic and add to the pot. Serve with rice and farofa.

description: Brazilian cheese bread, a small, baked cheese roll, a popular snack and breakfast food.
preparation: 1. Heat milk and oil. 2. Mix with tapioca flour to form a dough. 3. Once cooled, knead in eggs and cheese. 4. Form small balls and bake until puffed and golden.

description: A Brazilian seafood stew with fish or shrimp, coconut milk, tomatoes, onions, garlic, and cilantro.
preparation: 1. Marinate fish in lime juice and garlic. 2. Sauté vegetables. 3. Layer fish and vegetables in a clay pot, add coconut milk. 4. Simmer until fish is cooked. Finish with dendê oil and cilantro.

description: The national dish of Argentina; a barbecue of various meats, especially beef, grilled on a parilla (open fire grill).
preparation: 1. Prepare a wood or charcoal fire. 2. Salt the meat generously. 3. Grill slowly over low heat until cooked through and tender. 4. Serve with chimichurri sauce.

description: Baked or fried turnovers with various fillings like beef, chicken, cheese, or corn.
preparation: 1. Prepare the beef filling and let it cool. 2. Place a spoonful of filling on a dough disc. 3. Fold and seal the edges. 4. Bake or fry until golden.

description: Grilled steak served with a vibrant, uncooked sauce of parsley, garlic, olive oil, and vinegar.
ingredients: ['Skirt steak', 'Fresh parsley', 'Garlic', 'Olive oil', 'Red wine vinegar', 'Dried oregano', 'Red pepper flakes']
preparation: 1. Grill the steak to your liking. 2. Finely chop parsley and garlic, then mix with oil, vinegar, and spices to make the chimichurri. 3. Slice the steak and serve with the sauce.

description: A flat, round, unleavened patty of ground maize dough, grilled or fried, and stuffed with various fillings.
ingredients: ['Masarepa (pre-cooked cornmeal)', 'Water', 'Salt', 'Cheese, shredded beef, or beans for filling']
preparation: 1. Mix masarepa, water, and salt to form a dough. 2. Shape into patties. 3. Cook on a griddle until golden on both sides. 4. Split open and stuff with your favorite filling.

description: A hearty Colombian platter featuring red beans, rice, ground meat, chicharrón, fried egg, plantain, and avocado.
preparation: 1. Cook the beans until tender. 2. Cook the rice and ground beef separately. 3. Fry the pork belly, plantains, and eggs. 4. Assemble all components on a large platter.

description: Venezuela's national dish, consisting of shredded beef, black beans, white rice, and fried plantains.
preparation: 1. Stew and shred the beef with seasoned vegetables. 2. Cook black beans and rice separately. 3. Slice and fry ripe plantains until caramelized. 4. Serve all components together.

description: Cuba's national dish, consisting of shredded beef stewed in a tomato-based sauce with peppers and onions.
preparation: 1. Pressure cook or slow cook the flank steak until tender. 2. Shred the beef. 3. Sauté vegetables, add tomato sauce and spices, then add the shredded beef. 4. Simmer until flavors meld.

description: Chicken dry-rubbed or wet marinated with a hot spice mixture called Jamaican jerk spice.
preparation: 1. Blend all marinade ingredients to make a paste. 2. Marinate chicken for at least 4 hours. 3. Grill over pimento wood (or charcoal) until cooked through and charred.

description: A deep-fried fritter made from black-eyed peas, onions, and salt, often stuffed with shrimp.
preparation: 1. Soak and peel black-eyed peas. 2. Blend with onion and salt to make a batter. 3. Deep fry spoonfuls of batter in palm oil. 4. Split and stuff with a spicy shrimp filling.

description: A traditional, hearty soup or stew with large pieces of meat, tubers, and vegetables.
preparation: 1. Brown the meat. 2. Add water, vegetables, and tubers. 3. Simmer for a long time until meat is tender and soup has thickened. 4. Season well and add cilantro at the end.

description: A traditional dish of rice and beans, often served for breakfast with eggs or cheese.
preparation: 1. Sauté onion and bell pepper. 2. Add cooked beans and their liquid. 3. Stir in cooked rice and cook until liquid is absorbed. 4. Mix in Salsa Lizano and cilantro.

description: A Spanish rice dish originally from Valencia, cooked in a wide, shallow pan with chicken, rabbit, and beans.
preparation: 1. Sauté meats in a paella pan. 2. Add vegetables, then water and saffron to make a broth. 3. Add rice and cook until it absorbs the liquid, forming a crispy bottom (socarrat).

description: A cold soup made of raw, blended vegetables, originating from the southern Spanish region of Andalusia.
preparation: 1. Chop all vegetables. 2. Blend vegetables with bread, olive oil, vinegar, and a little water until smooth. 3. Chill thoroughly before serving.

description: A traditional Spanish omelette made with eggs and potatoes, sometimes including onions.
preparation: 1. Slowly cook thinly sliced potatoes and onions in abundant olive oil until soft. 2. Drain oil and mix potatoes with beaten eggs. 3. Cook in a pan, flipping once, until set.

description: A popular Spanish tapa of fried potato cubes served with a spicy tomato sauce and sometimes aioli.
preparation: 1. Cube and fry potatoes until golden and crispy. 2. Make a sauce by simmering tomatoes, garlic, paprika, and vinegar. 3. Drizzle the hot sauce over the potatoes.

description: A classic Portuguese dish made from shreds of salted cod, onions, and thinly chopped fried potatoes, all bound with scrambled eggs.
preparation: 1. Desalt and shred the cod. 2. Julienne and fry potatoes. 3. Sauté onions, add the cod. 4. Mix in the potatoes and then add beaten eggs, stirring until just set.

description: A Portuguese sandwich made with bread, wet-cured ham, linguiça, steak, and covered with melted cheese and a hot tomato and beer sauce.
preparation: 1. Cook the steak and sausages. 2. Assemble the sandwich with the meats. 3. Cover with cheese and grill until melted. 4. Make the sauce with beer, tomato, and port, and pour over the sandwich.

description: A classic Roman pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, cured pork, and black pepper.
preparation: 1. Cook spaghetti. 2. Fry guanciale until crisp. 3. Whisk egg yolks with pecorino and lots of pepper. 4. Drain pasta, combine with guanciale, then add egg mixture off heat, stirring quickly to create a creamy sauce.

description: A typical Neapolitan pizza, made with San Marzano tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, salt, and extra-virgin olive oil.
ingredients: ['Pizza dough', 'San Marzano tomatoes', 'Fresh mozzarella', 'Fresh basil', 'Olive oil', 'Salt']
preparation: 1. Stretch pizza dough. 2. Top with crushed tomatoes, torn mozzarella, and basil leaves. 3. Drizzle with olive oil. 4. Bake in a very hot oven until crust is blistered and cheese is melted.

description: Layers of flat pasta with a rich meat sauce (ragù), béchamel sauce, and Parmesan cheese.
preparation: 1. Prepare the ragù by slow-cooking meat and vegetables. 2. Make the béchamel sauce. 3. Layer pasta, ragù, béchamel, and cheese in a baking dish. 4. Bake until golden and bubbly.

description: A creamy Italian rice dish flavored with saffron, beef broth, and Parmesan cheese.
preparation: 1. Toast rice with sautéed onion. 2. Add wine and cook until absorbed. 3. Gradually add hot broth and saffron, stirring constantly. 4. When rice is al dente, stir in butter and Parmesan (mantecatura).

description: A Milanese specialty of cross-cut veal shanks braised with vegetables, white wine, and broth.
ingredients: ['Veal shanks', 'Carrot', 'Onion', 'Celery', 'White wine', 'Beef broth', 'Tomatoes', 'Gremolata (parsley, lemon zest, garlic)']
preparation: 1. Sear floured veal shanks. 2. Sauté vegetables, add wine and tomatoes. 3. Return shanks to the pot, add broth, and braise slowly for 2 hours until tender. 4. Serve topped with gremolata.

description: A classic French stew of chicken braised slowly in red wine, lardons, mushrooms, and garlic.
preparation: 1. Sear chicken and bacon. 2. Sauté vegetables. 3. Deglaze with brandy, add wine, and return chicken to the pot. 4. Braise slowly until chicken is tender. Add sautéed mushrooms before serving.

description: A French beef stew braised in red wine, often red Burgundy, and beef stock, flavored with vegetables.
preparation: 1. Sear beef and bacon. 2. Sauté vegetables. 3. Add wine and broth, return beef to the pot. 4. Braise in the oven for 3 hours until beef is fork-tender. 5. Add glazed onions and mushrooms.

description: A vegetable stew from Provence, featuring eggplant, zucchini, tomatoes, bell peppers, and onions.
preparation: 1. Sauté each vegetable separately until lightly browned. 2. Sauté onion and garlic, add tomatoes to make a sauce. 3. Combine all cooked vegetables in the sauce and simmer gently.

description: A rich custard base topped with a layer of hardened caramelized sugar.
preparation: 1. Infuse cream with vanilla. 2. Whisk egg yolks and sugar. 3. Temper yolks with hot cream, then strain. 4. Bake in a water bath until set. 5. Chill, then sprinkle with sugar and caramelize with a torch.

description: A baked egg-based dish which is made with egg yolks and beaten egg whites combined with various other ingredients.
preparation: 1. Make a béchamel or pastry cream base and mix with egg yolks. 2. Beat egg whites to stiff peaks. 3. Gently fold egg whites into the base. 4. Pour into a prepared ramekin and bake until puffed and golden.

description: A very thin, breaded, and pan-fried cutlet made from veal.
preparation: 1. Pound veal cutlets very thin. 2. Dredge in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs. 3. Pan-fry in plenty of butter or lard until golden brown on both sides. 4. Serve with a lemon wedge.

description: A traditional Viennese strudel, a popular pastry in Austria, made with a thin, elastic dough filled with apples, raisins, and cinnamon.
preparation: 1. Stretch dough until paper-thin. 2. Sauté breadcrumbs in butter. 3. Mix apples with sugar, cinnamon, and raisins. 4. Layer breadcrumbs and apple mixture on dough, roll up, and bake until golden.

description: A classic German meal of pan-fried or grilled sausage served with fermented cabbage.
preparation: 1. Brown the bratwurst in a pan. 2. Sauté onion, add sauerkraut, apple, and beer. 3. Simmer together until flavors meld. 4. Serve bratwurst with the sauerkraut and mustard.

description: A chocolate sponge cake with a rich cherry filling, whipped cream, and chocolate shavings.
preparation: 1. Soak cake layers with kirsch syrup. 2. Layer cake with whipped cream and cherries. 3. Frost the entire cake with whipped cream. 4. Decorate with chocolate shavings and more cherries.

description: A baked bread product made from dough most commonly shaped into a twisted knot.
preparation: 1. Make the dough and let it rise. 2. Shape dough into pretzel form. 3. Dip in a baking soda solution. 4. Sprinkle with coarse salt and bake until deep brown.

description: A Swiss melted cheese dish served in a communal pot over a portable stove, eaten by dipping bread into the cheese.
preparation: 1. Rub a pot with a garlic clove. 2. Heat wine. 3. Gradually add grated cheese, stirring until melted. 4. Stir in cornstarch slurry and a splash of kirsch. 5. Serve with cubes of bread for dipping.

description: A semi-hard cow's milk cheese that is usually melted and scraped onto diners' plates; served with potatoes, pickles, and cured meats.
ingredients: ['Raclette cheese', 'Boiled new potatoes', 'Cornichons', 'Pickled onions', 'Cured meats (like prosciutto)']
preparation: 1. Heat raclette cheese using a special grill or in a pan. 2. Scrape the melted cheese over boiled potatoes. 3. Serve alongside pickles and cured meats.

description: A layered dish of eggplant or potato, with minced meat, and topped with a creamy béchamel sauce.
preparation: 1. Slice and fry or bake eggplant. 2. Make a meat sauce with lamb, onions, tomatoes, and spices. 3. Make a béchamel sauce. 4. Layer eggplant, meat sauce, and top with béchamel. 5. Bake until golden.

description: Greek street food consisting of small pieces of meat and sometimes vegetables grilled on a skewer.
ingredients: ['Pork or chicken', 'Olive oil', 'Lemon juice', 'Oregano', 'Garlic', 'Pita bread', 'Tzatziki sauce']
preparation: 1. Marinate meat cubes in oil, lemon juice, and herbs. 2. Thread onto skewers. 3. Grill until cooked through. 4. Serve in a warm pita with tzatziki, tomatoes, and onions.

description: A Greek savory pastry with a filling of chopped spinach, feta cheese, onions, and egg.
preparation: 1. Sauté onion, then wilt spinach. 2. Mix spinach with crumbled feta, dill, and eggs. 3. Layer buttered phyllo sheets in a pan, add filling, and top with more buttered phyllo. 4. Bake until golden.

description: Meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie, then sliced and served wrapped in a flatbread such as pita.
preparation: 1. Marinate meat slices. 2. Traditionally, stack and cook on a vertical spit. At home, pan-fry or roast. 3. Slice the meat and serve in a warm pita with toppings and tzatziki.

description: A hot dish consisting of fried fish in batter, served with chips (french fries).
ingredients: ['Cod or haddock fillets', 'Flour', 'Beer', 'Baking powder', 'Potatoes', 'Oil for frying']
preparation: 1. Make a batter with flour, beer, and baking powder. 2. Cut potatoes into chips and fry until partially cooked. 3. Dip fish in batter and deep-fry until golden. 4. Finish frying the chips until crisp.

description: A savory pie of minced lamb and vegetables, topped with a crust of mashed potato.
preparation: 1. Make the meat filling by cooking lamb with vegetables and broth. 2. Prepare creamy mashed potatoes. 3. Spread the meat filling in a dish, top with mashed potatoes. 4. Bake until the top is golden brown.

description: A substantial cooked breakfast, typically including bacon, sausages, eggs, black pudding, baked beans, tomatoes, and mushrooms.
preparation: 1. Cook sausages and bacon in a pan. 2. Fry mushrooms and tomatoes in the same pan. 3. Fry or scramble eggs. 4. Heat baked beans and black pudding. 5. Serve everything hot with toast.

description: A savory pudding containing sheep's pluck (heart, liver, and lungs), minced with onion, oatmeal, suet, spices, and stock.
preparation: 1. Boil the pluck, then mince. 2. Mix with toasted oatmeal, minced onion, suet, and spices. 3. Moisten with stock. 4. Traditionally, stuff into a sheep's stomach and simmer for 3 hours.

description: A traditional stew made from lamb or mutton, as well as potatoes, onions, and parsley.
preparation: 1. Layer sliced potatoes, onions, and carrots with pieces of lamb in a large pot. 2. Season each layer. 3. Add stock, bring to a boil, then simmer slowly for 2 hours until meat is tender.

description: A rich and creamy Belgian stew, traditionally made with fish but often with chicken, and vegetables.
preparation: 1. Poach chicken in broth with vegetables until tender. 2. Remove chicken and keep warm. 3. Thicken the broth by tempering a mixture of cream and egg yolks. 4. Return chicken to the creamy soup.

description: Waffles distinguished by their larger size, lighter batter, larger squares, and higher grid pattern.
preparation: 1. Activate yeast and mix a batter. For Brussels waffles, it's thin and uses beaten egg whites. For Liège, it's a thick, brioche-like dough with pearl sugar. 2. Let rise. 3. Cook in a deep-pocketed waffle iron.

description: A traditional Dutch dish made from a combination of mashed potatoes with one or several vegetables.
preparation: 1. Boil potatoes and kale together in one pot. 2. Drain and mash everything together with milk and butter. 3. Serve with a piece of smoked sausage and sometimes bacon.

description: Raw herring, lightly brined, served with chopped onions and pickles.
preparation: 1. The herring is cleaned and brined by the vendor. 2. It is served plain or on a bread roll with onions and pickles. The traditional way to eat it is to hold it by the tail and lower it into your mouth.

description: A traditional Danish open-faced sandwich, usually on dense, dark rye bread with various toppings.
preparation: 1. Butter a slice of rye bread. 2. Artfully arrange toppings such as herring with onions, roast beef with remoulade and fried onions, or shrimp with mayonnaise and dill.

description: Meatballs made from ground meat, served with gravy, boiled potatoes, lingonberry jam, and pickled cucumber.
preparation: 1. Mix meat, soaked breadcrumbs, sautéed onion, and spices. 2. Form small meatballs and pan-fry. 3. Make a cream gravy in the same pan. 4. Serve with traditional accompaniments.

description: A Nordic dish of raw salmon, cured using a mix of salt, sugar, and dill.
preparation: 1. Mix salt, sugar, and crushed peppercorns. 2. Rub the mixture over the salmon and cover with dill. 3. Wrap tightly and cure in the refrigerator for 2-3 days, turning occasionally. 4. Slice thinly to serve.

description: A sour soup popular in Eastern Europe, with beetroot as the main ingredient, giving it a distinctive red color.
preparation: 1. Sauté onions and carrots. 2. Add shredded beets, cabbage, and potatoes to a pot with stock. 3. Simmer until vegetables are tender. 4. Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream and fresh dill.

description: Russian dumplings consisting of a filling wrapped in thin, unleavened dough.
preparation: 1. Make a simple dough and let it rest. 2. Prepare the meat filling. 3. Roll out the dough, cut circles, place filling, and seal into dumplings. 4. Boil in salted water until they float and are cooked through.

description: A Russian dish of sautéed pieces of beef served in a sauce with smetana (sour cream).
preparation: 1. Quickly sear strips of beef and set aside. 2. Sauté onions and mushrooms. 3. Make a pan sauce with broth and mustard. 4. Stir in sour cream off the heat, then return the beef to the pan. Serve over noodles.

description: Filled dumplings of Central and Eastern European origin, made by wrapping unleavened dough around a savory or sweet filling.
preparation: 1. Make the dough. 2. Prepare the filling (e.g., mashed potato and cheese). 3. Fill and seal dumplings. 4. Boil until they float, then pan-fry in butter with onions and bacon until golden.

description: A Polish hunter's stew made of finely chopped meat of various kinds stewed with sauerkraut and shredded fresh cabbage.
preparation: 1. Brown meats. 2. Combine all ingredients in a large pot. 3. Simmer slowly for several hours, or even days, reheating to deepen the flavor. It's said to taste better each day.

description: A Hungarian stew of meat and vegetables, seasoned with paprika and other spices.
preparation: 1. Sauté a large amount of onions until soft. 2. Add paprika and beef, then sear. 3. Add other ingredients and stock. 4. Simmer slowly for at least 2 hours until the beef is very tender.

description: A Hungarian deep-fried flatbread topped with sour cream and grated cheese, or garlic.
preparation: 1. Make a soft yeast dough and let it rise. 2. Stretch pieces of dough into flat discs. 3. Deep-fry until golden brown. 4. Rub with garlic and top with sour cream and grated cheese.

description: Grilled dish of minced meat, a type of skinless sausage, found traditionally in the countries of southeastern Europe.
preparation: 1. Mix meats and seasonings. Let the mixture rest for several hours. 2. Form into small, finger-like sausages. 3. Grill over charcoal until cooked through. 4. Serve with flatbread, onions, and ajvar.

description: A Serbian grilled dish of a spiced meat patty mixture of pork, beef and lamb.
preparation: 1. Finely chop onion and garlic, mix with meats and spices. 2. Add sparkling water to make it lighter. Let it rest. 3. Form large, thin patties. 4. Grill until cooked. Serve in a flatbread (lepinja).

description: A Bulgarian cold salad popular throughout Southeastern Europe. It is made from tomatoes, cucumbers, onion, raw or roasted peppers, and sirene cheese.
preparation: 1. Chop tomatoes, cucumbers, onion, and peppers into small cubes. 2. Toss with oil and vinegar. 3. Top with a generous amount of grated or crumbled sirene cheese.

description: Romanian cabbage rolls, made of cabbage leaves filled with minced meat, rice, and spices.
preparation: 1. Prepare cabbage leaves. 2. Make filling by mixing raw pork, rice, sautéed onion, and herbs. 3. Roll filling in cabbage leaves. 4. Layer in a pot with bacon and tomato juice, and simmer slowly for hours.

description: A Japanese dish of prepared vinegared rice, accompanying a variety of ingredients, such as seafood, vegetables, and occasionally tropical fruits.
preparation: 1. Cook and season sushi rice. 2. Lay nori on a bamboo mat, spread a thin layer of rice. 3. Add fillings like fish and vegetables. 4. Roll tightly and slice into pieces.

description: A Japanese noodle soup, with a combination of a rich flavored broth, one of a variety of noodles, and a selection of meats or vegetables as toppings.
ingredients: ['Ramen noodles', 'Pork belly', 'Soft-boiled egg', 'Nori', 'Scallions', 'Pork or chicken broth', 'Miso or soy sauce']
preparation: 1. Prepare a complex broth over many hours. 2. Cook ramen noodles. 3. Assemble the bowl: noodles first, then pour over hot broth. 4. Top with sliced pork, egg, nori, and scallions.

description: A Japanese dish of seafood or vegetables that have been battered and deep-fried.
preparation: 1. Make a light, airy batter with flour, egg, and ice water; do not overmix. 2. Dip shrimp and vegetables into the batter. 3. Deep-fry in hot oil for a short time until lightly golden and crispy.

description: A Japanese dish which consists of a breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet.
ingredients: ['Pork loin cutlet', 'Flour', 'Egg', 'Panko (Japanese breadcrumbs)', 'Oil for frying', 'Tonkatsu sauce']
preparation: 1. Season the pork cutlet. 2. Dredge in flour, dip in beaten egg, and coat thoroughly with panko. 3. Deep-fry until golden brown and cooked through. 4. Slice and serve with tonkatsu sauce and shredded cabbage.

description: A savory Japanese pancake containing a variety of ingredients, topped with a sweet sauce, mayonnaise, and bonito flakes.
ingredients: ['Flour', 'Cabbage', 'Pork belly slices', 'Egg', 'Dashi stock', 'Okonomiyaki sauce', 'Japanese mayonnaise', 'Bonito flakes']
preparation: 1. Mix flour, egg, dashi, and shredded cabbage to make a batter. 2. Pour onto a griddle, top with pork slices. 3. Flip and cook until done. 4. Top with okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, and bonito flakes.

description: A traditional Korean side dish of salted and fermented vegetables, such as napa cabbage and Korean radish.
preparation: 1. Brine cabbage in salt water. 2. Make a paste with chili powder, garlic, ginger, fish sauce. 3. Mix paste with radish and scallions. 4. Rub paste onto each cabbage leaf. 5. Pack into a jar and let it ferment.

description: A Korean rice dish served with sautéed vegetables, chili paste, and topped with a raw or fried egg and sliced meat.
preparation: 1. Cook rice. 2. Sauté various vegetables and beef separately. 3. Arrange rice in a bowl, top with the prepared ingredients in sections. 4. Add a fried egg and a dollop of gochujang. Mix before eating.

description: A Korean dish of thin, marinated slices of beef grilled on a barbecue or on a stove-top griddle.
preparation: 1. Make a marinade with soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, garlic, and grated pear. 2. Marinate the beef slices for at least 30 minutes. 3. Grill or pan-fry quickly over high heat until caramelized.

description: Spicy stir-fried rice cakes, a popular Korean street food.
preparation: 1. Make a broth with anchovies. 2. Stir in gochujang, gochugaru, and sugar. 3. Add rice cakes and fish cakes and simmer until the sauce has thickened and the cakes are soft.

description: A variety of fried chicken dishes from South Korea, known for being extra crispy and often coated in a sweet and spicy sauce.
preparation: 1. Coat chicken in starch and flour. 2. Double-fry the chicken for extra crispiness. 3. Make a glaze by simmering gochujang, honey, soy sauce, and garlic. 4. Toss the fried chicken in the glaze.

description: A famous duck dish from Beijing that has been prepared since the imperial era, prized for its thin, crisp skin.
preparation: 1. Prepare the duck by pumping air under the skin, scalding, and coating with syrup. 2. Hang to dry for 24 hours. 3. Roast in a very hot oven until the skin is deep brown and crispy. 4. Carve skin and meat, serve with pancakes and accompaniments.

description: A spicy, stir-fried Chinese dish made with chicken, peanuts, vegetables, and chili peppers.
preparation: 1. Marinate diced chicken. 2. Stir-fry dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns to flavor the oil. 3. Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked. 4. Add peanuts and a sauce made from soy sauce, vinegar, and sugar.

description: A large range of small dishes that Cantonese people traditionally enjoy in restaurants for breakfast and lunch.
ingredients: ['Shrimp (for har gow)', 'Pork (for siu mai)', 'Wonton wrappers', 'Rice noodle sheets', 'Various fillings']
preparation: 1. Prepare various fillings. 2. Wrap fillings in different types of dough or wrappers (e.g., shrimp in translucent dough for har gow). 3. Steam, fry, or bake in small portions. 4. Serve in small steamer baskets.

description: A popular Chinese dish from Sichuan province. It consists of tofu set in a spicy sauce, typically a thin, oily, and bright red suspension.
ingredients: ['Silken tofu', 'Ground pork', 'Doubanjiang (fermented broad bean paste)', 'Sichuan peppercorns', 'Chili flakes', 'Garlic', 'Ginger']
preparation: 1. Gently boil tofu cubes. 2. Stir-fry ground pork. 3. Add doubanjiang, chili, garlic, and ginger. 4. Add stock and simmer, then add the tofu. 5. Thicken with cornstarch and finish with ground Sichuan peppercorns.

description: A Chinese cooking method, prepared with a simmering pot of soup stock at the dining table, containing a variety of East Asian foodstuffs and ingredients.
preparation: 1. Prepare a simmering broth in a pot on the table. 2. Arrange various raw ingredients on platters. 3. Diners cook their chosen ingredients in the communal pot. 4. Dip cooked items in personal dipping sauces.

description: A Taiwanese tea-based drink invented in the 1980s, containing chewy tapioca balls ('boba').
preparation: 1. Brew strong black tea and let it cool. 2. Cook tapioca pearls according to package directions. 3. Make a simple sugar syrup. 4. Assemble by adding pearls, syrup, tea, and milk to a glass. Shake with ice.

description: A popular Taiwanese noodle soup made of stewed or red braised beef, beef broth, vegetables and Chinese noodles.
ingredients: ['Beef shank', 'Soy sauce', 'Star anise', 'Cinnamon', 'Sichuan peppercorns', 'Noodles', 'Bok choy', 'Pickled mustard greens']
preparation: 1. Braise beef shank with spices and soy sauce for several hours until very tender. 2. Cook noodles. 3. Blanch bok choy. 4. Serve noodles in the rich beef broth, topped with sliced beef, bok choy, and pickled greens.

description: A common street food in Thailand, it is a stir-fried rice noodle dish.
ingredients: ['Rice noodles', 'Shrimp or chicken', 'Tofu', 'Bean sprouts', 'Eggs', 'Tamarind paste', 'Fish sauce', 'Sugar', 'Peanuts']
preparation: 1. Soak rice noodles. 2. Make a sauce with tamarind, fish sauce, and sugar. 3. Stir-fry tofu and protein. 4. Add noodles and sauce, stir-fry until cooked. 5. Push to one side, scramble an egg. 6. Add bean sprouts and chives, top with peanuts.

description: A central Thai variety of curry. The name derives from the color of the dish, which comes from green chilies.
ingredients: ['Green curry paste', 'Coconut milk', 'Chicken or beef', 'Thai eggplant', 'Bamboo shoots', 'Thai basil', 'Fish sauce']
preparation: 1. Fry curry paste in coconut cream until fragrant. 2. Add chicken and cook through. 3. Add the rest of the coconut milk, vegetables, and seasonings. 4. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Stir in Thai basil at the end.

description: A type of hot and sour Thai soup, usually cooked with shrimp.
preparation: 1. Boil water or stock with lemongrass, galangal, and lime leaves. 2. Add mushrooms and shrimp. 3. Season with chili paste, fish sauce, and lime juice. 4. Do not overcook the shrimp.

description: A traditional Thai dessert made with glutinous rice, fresh mango, and coconut milk.
preparation: 1. Steam glutinous rice. 2. Heat coconut milk with sugar and salt to make a sauce. 3. Mix most of the sauce with the hot sticky rice. 4. Serve the sweet rice with fresh mango slices and a drizzle of the remaining coconut sauce.

description: A Vietnamese soup consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat, primarily beef or chicken.
ingredients: ['Beef bones', 'Star anise', 'Cinnamon', 'Ginger', 'Rice noodles', 'Thinly sliced beef', 'Bean sprouts', 'Thai basil', 'Lime']
preparation: 1. Simmer beef bones and charred aromatics for many hours to create a clear, flavorful broth. 2. Cook rice noodles. 3. Place noodles and raw sliced beef in a bowl. 4. Pour boiling hot broth over to cook the beef. 5. Serve with fresh herbs.

description: A Vietnamese sandwich, a product of French colonialism in Indochina, served in a crispy baguette.
ingredients: ['Baguette', 'Grilled pork or pâté', 'Pickled carrots and daikon', 'Cucumber', 'Cilantro', 'Mayonnaise', 'Jalapeños']
preparation: 1. Toast a light and airy baguette. 2. Spread with pâté and mayonnaise. 3. Fill with your choice of protein, pickled vegetables, cucumber, cilantro, and chili.

description: Vietnamese fresh spring rolls, typically consisting of pork, prawn, vegetables, bún (rice vermicelli), and other ingredients wrapped in rice paper.
ingredients: ['Rice paper wrappers', 'Cooked shrimp', 'Cooked pork', 'Rice vermicelli noodles', 'Lettuce', 'Fresh mint', 'Peanut dipping sauce']
preparation: 1. Soften a sheet of rice paper in water. 2. Layer lettuce, noodles, herbs, shrimp, and pork. 3. Roll tightly like a burrito. 4. Serve fresh with a peanut dipping sauce.

description: A spicy noodle soup popular in the Peranakan cuisine, consisting of rice noodles with chicken, prawn or fish, served in spicy soup.
ingredients: ['Laksa paste', 'Coconut milk', 'Chicken stock', 'Rice noodles', 'Shrimp', 'Tofu puffs', 'Bean sprouts', 'Hard-boiled egg']
preparation: 1. Sauté laksa paste. 2. Add stock and coconut milk and bring to a simmer to create the soup. 3. Cook noodles. 4. Assemble by placing noodles in a bowl, adding toppings, and ladling hot soup over.

description: Malaysia's national dish, a fragrant rice dish cooked in coconut milk and pandan leaf, served with various accompaniments.
preparation: 1. Cook rice with coconut milk and pandan leaves. 2. Prepare sambal. 3. Fry anchovies and peanuts until crispy. 4. Serve the fragrant rice with a spoonful of sambal and all the accompaniments.

description: A dish of poached chicken and seasoned rice, served with chili sauce and usually with cucumber garnishes.
preparation: 1. Poach a whole chicken with ginger and scallions. 2. Use the chicken broth to cook the rice with chicken fat and aromatics. 3. Chop the chicken. 4. Serve chicken with the fragrant rice and a chili-lime dipping sauce.

description: A dish of seasoned, skewered and grilled meat, served with a sauce.
preparation: 1. Marinate sliced meat in a spice blend. 2. Thread meat onto bamboo skewers. 3. Grill over charcoal until cooked. 4. Make a peanut sauce by blending roasted peanuts with spices and coconut milk. Serve together.

description: Indonesian fried rice, typically spiced with kecap manis (sweet soy sauce), shallot, and chili.
preparation: 1. Sauté shallots, garlic, and chili. 2. Add chicken and shrimp. 3. Add rice and kecap manis, stir-frying over high heat. 4. Serve topped with a fried egg and shrimp crackers.

description: A rich and tender coconut beef stew which is explosively flavorful, originating from the Minangkabau people of Indonesia.
preparation: 1. Blend spices into a paste. 2. Sauté the paste, then add beef and coconut milk. 3. Simmer slowly for 3-4 hours, stirring occasionally, until the liquid evaporates and the beef is tender and caramelized.

description: A popular Filipino dish and cooking process involving meat, seafood, or vegetables marinated in vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, and black peppercorns.
preparation: 1. Marinate meat in soy sauce, vinegar, and garlic. 2. Simmer the meat in its marinade with bay leaves and peppercorns until tender. 3. Optionally, pan-fry the meat after simmering to brown it.

description: A Filipino soup or stew characterized by its sour and savory taste, most often associated with tamarind.
ingredients: ['Pork ribs or shrimp', 'Tamarind paste', 'Radish (labanos)', 'Taro (gabi)', 'Water spinach (kangkong)', 'String beans', 'Tomato', 'Onion']
preparation: 1. Boil pork until tender. 2. Add onion, tomato, and taro. 3. Add tamarind paste for sourness. 4. Add other vegetables like radish and beans. 5. Add leafy greens at the very end.

description: A whole roasted pig cooked over charcoal. It is a national dish of the Philippines.
preparation: 1. Clean a whole pig. 2. Season generously inside and out. Stuff the cavity with lemongrass and other aromatics. 3. Skewer on a large bamboo pole. 4. Roast slowly over a charcoal pit for many hours, basting the skin, until it is golden and crispy.

description: A type of curry made from chicken with a spiced tomato and butter (makhan) sauce.
preparation: 1. Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices. 2. Grill or pan-fry the chicken (tandoori style). 3. Make a smooth, buttery gravy with tomatoes, cream, and spices. 4. Add the cooked chicken to the gravy and simmer.

description: A fried or baked pastry with a savory filling, such as spiced potatoes, onions, peas, or lentils.
preparation: 1. Make a firm dough and let it rest. 2. Prepare a spiced potato and pea filling. 3. Roll out dough, cut, form into cones, and stuff with filling. 4. Seal and deep-fry until golden and crispy.

description: A mixed rice dish with its origins among the Muslims of the Indian subcontinent.
preparation: 1. Marinate meat in yogurt and spices. 2. Par-boil basmati rice. 3. Layer the marinated meat and partially cooked rice in a heavy-bottomed pot, topped with fried onions, mint, and saffron milk. 4. Seal the pot and cook on low heat (dum).

description: A vegetarian dish from the Indian subcontinent, consisting of paneer (Indian cheese) in a thick paste made from puréed spinach.
preparation: 1. Blanch and purée spinach. 2. Sauté onion, ginger, garlic, and tomatoes to make a masala base. 3. Add the spinach purée and spices. 4. Add cubes of paneer and a splash of cream. Simmer gently.

description: A popular vegetarian dish from the Indian subcontinent, made with chickpeas in a spicy tomato-based sauce.
preparation: 1. Sauté onions, ginger, and garlic. 2. Add tomatoes and powdered spices and cook until oil separates. 3. Add boiled chickpeas and simmer until the gravy thickens. 4. Garnish with cilantro.

description: Chicken roasted in a tandoor after being marinated in yogurt and spices.
preparation: 1. Make deep gashes in chicken pieces. 2. Marinate in a mixture of yogurt and spices for at least 6 hours. 3. Traditionally cooked in a tandoor (clay oven), but can be grilled or baked at high heat until charred and cooked through.

description: A popular dish from the Punjab region of the Indian subcontinent made with whole black lentils (urad) and red kidney beans (rajma).
preparation: 1. Soak lentils and beans overnight. 2. Pressure cook until very soft. 3. Prepare a masala with tomatoes, onions, ginger, and garlic. 4. Combine lentils and masala, then simmer for a long time. 5. Finish with a generous amount of butter and cream.

description: A slow-cooked stew of beef or lamb shank along with bone marrow.
ingredients: ['Beef or lamb shanks', 'Onion', 'Yogurt', 'Ginger', 'Garlic', 'Nihari masala (a spice mix)', 'Flour']
preparation: 1. Brown the meat and sauté with aromatics. 2. Add yogurt, spices, and water. 3. Slow cook for 6-8 hours until the meat is extremely tender. 4. Thicken the stew with a flour slurry. Serve with ginger and lime.

description: A stew popular in the Middle East, Central Asia, and the Indian subcontinent, made of wheat, barley, meat, lentils and spices.
preparation: 1. Cook meat and grains/lentils separately until very soft. 2. Shred the meat and pound or blend the grains into a thick paste. 3. Combine the two and cook together with spices until it forms a thick, porridge-like consistency. 4. Serve with fried onions and lemon.

description: A dish originating in the Indian subcontinent, consisting of meat or vegetables braised with yogurt or cream, water or stock, and spices to produce a thick sauce.
preparation: 1. Make a paste from fried onions, yogurt, and nuts. 2. Sauté whole spices, then brown the meat. 3. Add the onion-yogurt paste and other spices and cook until fragrant. 4. Add water or stock and simmer until meat is tender and sauce is thick.

description: A Turkish dish made of meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie.
preparation: 1. Marinate thin slices of meat. 2. Stack the meat tightly onto a vertical spit. 3. Cook by rotating next to a heat source. 4. Shave off thin slices of cooked meat. 5. Serve in flatbread with salad and sauce.

description: A rich, sweet dessert pastry made of layers of filo filled with chopped nuts and sweetened and held together with syrup or honey.
preparation: 1. Layer buttered phyllo sheets with chopped nuts. 2. Cut into desired shapes (diamonds or squares). 3. Bake until golden and crisp. 4. Prepare a sugar syrup. 5. Pour the hot syrup over the hot pastry and let it soak.

description: A family of stuffed dishes common in the Mediterranean Cuisine and surrounding regions. Can be grape leaves, peppers, or zucchini.
preparation: 1. Prepare a filling with rice, herbs, and optional meat. 2. Blanch grape leaves to soften. 3. Place a small amount of filling on each leaf and roll tightly. 4. Arrange in a pot, cover with water and lemon juice, and simmer until rice is cooked.

description: A round, thin piece of dough topped with minced meat, minced vegetables and herbs including onions, tomatoes and parsley, then baked.
preparation: 1. Make a simple yeast dough. 2. Finely mince vegetables and mix with ground lamb and spices. 3. Roll out dough into thin discs. 4. Spread a thin layer of the meat mixture on top. 5. Bake in a very hot oven for a few minutes.

description: A Middle Eastern dip, spread, or savory dish made from cooked, mashed chickpeas blended with tahini, lemon juice, and garlic.
preparation: 1. Cook chickpeas until very soft (or use canned). 2. Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and a little water until very smooth. 3. Season with salt. 4. Serve drizzled with olive oil.

description: A Levantine vegetarian salad made mostly of finely chopped parsley, with tomatoes, mint, onion, bulgur, and seasoned with olive oil and lemon juice.
preparation: 1. Soak bulgur wheat. 2. Finely chop a large amount of parsley, mint, tomatoes, and onion. 3. Squeeze excess water from bulgur. 4. Combine all ingredients and dress with lemon juice and olive oil.

description: A deep-fried ball or patty made from ground chickpeas, fava beans, or both.
preparation: 1. Soak dried chickpeas overnight (do not cook). 2. Grind chickpeas with herbs and spices to make a coarse mixture. 3. Form into balls or patties. 4. Deep-fry until golden brown and crispy.

description: A dish in Middle Eastern cuisine consisting of meat cut into thin slices, stacked in a cone-like shape, and roasted on a slowly-turning vertical rotisserie.
ingredients: ['Chicken or beef', 'Yogurt', 'Lemon juice', 'Garlic', 'Spices (cumin, coriander, turmeric)', 'Pita bread']
preparation: 1. Marinate meat in a spiced yogurt marinade. 2. Stack and roast on a vertical spit. 3. Shave off cooked meat. 4. Serve wrapped in pita bread with garlic sauce (toum) and pickles.

description: The national dish of Jordan, a large platter of rice, lamb, and a yogurt-based sauce called jameed.
preparation: 1. Rehydrate and cook the jameed to make a sauce. 2. Cook lamb in the jameed sauce until very tender. 3. Cook rice. 4. Assemble by layering flatbread, rice, and lamb on a large platter. Pour sauce over and garnish with nuts.

description: A Maghrebi dish of eggs poached in a sauce of tomatoes, olive oil, peppers, onion and garlic, commonly spiced with cumin, paprika and cayenne pepper.
preparation: 1. Sauté onion, pepper, and garlic. 2. Add tomatoes and spices and simmer to create a thick sauce. 3. Make wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each. 4. Cover and cook until eggs are set to your liking. Top with feta and parsley.

description: A mixed rice dish that originates from Saudi Arabia, made with rice and meat.
ingredients: ['Basmati rice', 'Chicken or lamb', 'Onions', 'Tomatoes', 'Loomi (dried lime)', 'Spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon)']
preparation: 1. Brown the meat with onions and whole spices. 2. Add tomatoes, water, and loomi and cook the meat until tender. 3. Remove the meat, then cook the rice in the flavorful broth. 4. Serve the rice topped with the meat and toasted nuts.

description: A traditional dish of Kuwait and Bahrain, it's a spiced rice dish with chicken or mutton.
preparation: 1. Cook chicken with onions, spices, and loomi until tender. 2. Remove chicken and grill or fry to brown. 3. Cook rice in the chicken broth. 4. Serve rice topped with the chicken, garnished with fried onions and raisins.

description: The national dish of Iran, consisting of steamed, saffroned Persian rice (chelow) and kebab.
preparation: 1. Prepare Persian-style rice (chelow) with a crispy bottom (tahdig). 2. Grate onion and mix with ground meat to make kebab koobideh. 3. Mold onto skewers and grill over charcoal. 4. Serve kebab with saffron rice, butter, sumac, and grilled tomatoes.

description: An Iranian stew flavored with pomegranate paste and ground walnuts.
preparation: 1. Brown chicken pieces. 2. Sauté onion, then add finely ground walnuts and cook until toasty. 3. Add pomegranate molasses, water, and seasonings. 4. Add chicken and simmer slowly for at least an hour until the sauce is thick and dark.

description: A Central Asian rice pilaf dish made with rice, meat (usually lamb), carrots, and onions.
preparation: 1. Heat oil in a heavy pot (kazan). 2. Brown lamb and onions. 3. Add julienned carrots and cook until soft. 4. Add water, whole garlic heads, and cumin. 5. Layer rice on top, add more water, and steam until cooked.

description: A Central Asian dish of hand-pulled noodles, meat, and vegetables in a savory broth.
preparation: 1. Make and hand-pull the noodles. 2. Boil the noodles. 3. Make a stew by stir-frying meat and vegetables, then adding broth and simmering. 4. Serve the noodles topped with the rich meat and vegetable stew.

description: A type of steamed filled dumpling that is native to Tibet and Nepal.
preparation: 1. Make a simple dough. 2. Prepare the filling with ground meat or vegetables and aromatics. 3. Roll out small circles of dough, fill, and pleat to seal. 4. Steam for 10-15 minutes. Serve with a spicy dipping sauce.

description: A North African stew, named after the earthenware pot in which it is cooked.
preparation: 1. Brown meat in the tagine base. 2. Add onions, spices, and a little water. 3. Cover with the conical lid and simmer on low heat for several hours until the meat is tender. 4. Add dried fruit and nuts near the end. Serve with couscous.

description: A North African dish of small steamed balls of crushed durum wheat semolina, traditionally served with a stew spooned on top.
preparation: 1. Prepare a hearty stew with meat and/or vegetables. 2. Steam the couscous grains over the simmering stew until light and fluffy. 3. Serve the fluffy couscous on a large platter, making a well in the center for the stew.

description: A traditional Moroccan pie that is a mix of sweet and savory flavors, with a flaky crust enclosing a filling of pigeon or chicken, almonds, and eggs.
preparation: 1. Cook and shred chicken in a spiced broth. 2. Thicken broth with eggs. 3. Prepare a sweet almond layer. 4. Layer pastry with chicken mixture and almond mixture. 5. Bake until golden and top with powdered sugar and cinnamon.

description: Egypt's national dish, a satisfying mix of rice, macaroni, and lentils, topped with a spicy tomato sauce and fried onions.
preparation: 1. Cook rice, lentils, and macaroni separately. 2. Make a spicy tomato-vinegar sauce. 3. Fry thinly sliced onions until crispy. 4. Serve by layering rice, lentils, and macaroni, then topping with chickpeas, tomato sauce, and fried onions.

description: A staple food in Egypt, a stew of cooked fava beans served with vegetable oil, cumin, and optionally with chopped parsley, garlic, onion, and lemon juice.
preparation: 1. Soak and slow-cook fava beans for several hours until very tender. 2. Mash the beans lightly. 3. Season with garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, and cumin. 4. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with bread.

description: A one-pot rice dish popular in many West African countries, cooked in a flavorful tomato-based broth.
ingredients: ['Long-grain rice', 'Tomatoes', 'Red bell pepper', 'Scotch bonnet pepper', 'Onion', 'Thyme', 'Curry powder', 'Chicken stock']
preparation: 1. Blend tomatoes, peppers, and onion into a smooth paste. 2. Sauté the paste to cook it down and concentrate the flavor. 3. Add stock, seasonings, and washed rice. 4. Cover and cook on low heat until rice is cooked and has absorbed the sauce.

description: A spicy meat skewer which is a popular food item in West Africa. It is traditionally prepared by the Hausa people of northern Nigeria.
ingredients: ['Thinly sliced beef', 'Yaji (suya spice mix)', 'Peanut powder', 'Paprika', 'Cayenne', 'Ginger powder']
preparation: 1. Mix peanut powder and spices to make yaji. 2. Coat the beef slices thoroughly in the spice mix. 3. Thread the beef onto skewers. 4. Grill over hot coals until cooked through. Serve with onions and tomatoes.

description: A rich Nigerian soup made with ground melon seeds, leafy vegetables, and meat or fish.
ingredients: ['Ground egusi (melon seeds)', 'Beef or fish', 'Palm oil', 'Spinach or bitter leaf', 'Crayfish', 'Stock', 'Onion', 'Peppers']
preparation: 1. Boil meat until tender. 2. Heat palm oil, sauté onions, and fry the ground egusi paste. 3. Add meat stock, crayfish, and peppers. 4. Simmer, then add the cooked meat and leafy vegetables.

description: A spicy Ethiopian chicken stew, often considered the national dish. It is slow-cooked with a large amount of onions and berbere spice.
ingredients: ['Chicken', 'Onions', 'Niter kibbeh (spiced clarified butter)', 'Berbere spice mix', 'Hard-boiled eggs', 'Garlic', 'Ginger']
preparation: 1. Slowly cook a large quantity of finely chopped onions without oil until soft and reduced. 2. Add niter kibbeh and berbere, and cook to a deep red paste. 3. Add chicken pieces and simmer for a long time. 4. Add hard-boiled eggs at the end. Serve with injera.

description: A sour fermented flatbread with a slightly spongy texture, traditionally made out of teff flour.
preparation: 1. Mix teff flour and water to make a thin batter. 2. Allow the batter to ferment for 1-3 days until bubbly and sour. 3. Pour a thin layer of batter onto a hot, ungreased griddle (mitad). 4. Cook briefly, only on one side, until the top is covered with small holes.

description: An Ethiopian dish of minced raw beef, marinated in mitmita (a chili powder-based spice blend) and niter kibbeh.
ingredients: ['Lean beef', 'Niter kibbeh (spiced clarified butter)', 'Mitmita spice blend', 'Cardamom']
preparation: 1. Finely mince high-quality raw beef. 2. Gently warm the niter kibbeh. 3. Mix the minced beef with the warm niter kibbeh and mitmita spice. 4. It can be served raw (tere), lightly cooked (leb leb), or fully cooked (yebesela).

description: A South African fast food dish consisting of a hollowed-out loaf of white bread filled with curry.
ingredients: ['Loaf of white bread', 'Chicken or lamb curry', 'Potatoes', 'Onion', 'Garlic', 'Curry spices']
preparation: 1. Prepare a flavorful, saucy curry. 2. Cut a loaf of bread in half or quarters. 3. Hollow out the inside of the bread, leaving a crusty shell. 4. Fill the bread bowl with the hot curry. Use the removed bread for dipping.

description: A form of dried, cured meat that originated in Southern African countries.
preparation: 1. Cut beef into thick strips. 2. Coat with salt, toasted coriander, and pepper. 3. Dip briefly in vinegar. 4. Hang the strips in a dry, well-ventilated area for several days to a week until dried to your liking.

description: A South African dish consisting of spiced minced meat baked with an egg-based topping.
preparation: 1. Mix minced meat with soaked bread, sautéed onion, spices, jam, and raisins. 2. Press into an oven dish. 3. Make a custard topping with eggs and milk, pour over the meat. 4. Bake until the topping is set and golden.

description: A Kenyan specialty of grilled meat, most often goat, which is slow-roasted over an open fire.
preparation: 1. Take large cuts of goat meat (like a leg or shoulder). 2. Season simply with salt and pepper. 3. Roast slowly over hot coals for a long time until tender and cooked through. 4. Carve and serve with kachumbari (tomato and onion salad) and ugali.

description: A dense porridge made from maize flour, a staple food in parts of Africa.
preparation: 1. Bring water to a boil. 2. Gradually add maize flour while stirring continuously with a wooden spoon. 3. Continue to stir and cook, pressing against the side of the pot, until it forms a very thick, firm paste. 4. Shape and serve with stews or greens.

description: A popular street food in Tanzania, it's a thin dough filled with minced meat, egg, and vegetables, then folded and pan-fried.
preparation: 1. Stretch a ball of dough paper-thin. 2. Place raw minced meat, chopped vegetables, and cheese in the center. 3. Crack a raw egg on top. 4. Fold the dough into a square packet. 5. Pan-fry on a large griddle until crispy and cooked through.

description: The national dish of Senegal, it is a flavorful dish of fish, rice and tomato sauce cooked with a variety of vegetables.
preparation: 1. Marinate and fry the fish. 2. Make a rich sauce with tomato paste, vegetables, and seasonings. Cook the vegetables in the sauce. 3. Remove fish and vegetables. Cook the rice in the remaining flavorful sauce.

description: A spicy dish from Senegal prepared with chicken, onions, and lemon.
preparation: 1. Marinate chicken in a mixture of lemon juice, sliced onions, and mustard for several hours. 2. Brown the chicken pieces. 3. Sauté the onions from the marinade until caramelized. 4. Return chicken to the pot with some water and simmer until cooked through.

description: A traditional Moroccan soup, especially popular during Ramadan. It is a tomato-based soup with lentils, chickpeas, and meat.
preparation: 1. Sauté meat and vegetables. 2. Add tomatoes, legumes, and spices with water and simmer until tender. 3. Thicken the soup with a mixture of flour and water (tadwira). 4. Add vermicelli and fresh herbs at the end.

description: A meringue-based dessert with a crisp crust and soft, light inside, usually topped with fruit and whipped cream.
ingredients: ['Egg whites', 'Caster sugar', 'Cornflour', 'White vinegar', 'Vanilla extract', 'Heavy cream', 'Fresh fruit (berries, kiwi)']
preparation: 1. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. 2. Gradually beat in sugar until glossy. Fold in cornflour, vinegar, and vanilla. 3. Shape into a circle on a baking sheet. 4. Bake at a low temperature until crisp. 5. Cool completely, then top with whipped cream and fruit.

description: An Australian cake made from squares of butter cake or sponge cake coated in an outer layer of chocolate sauce and rolled in desiccated coconut.
preparation: 1. Bake a sponge or butter cake and cut into squares. 2. Make a thin chocolate icing. 3. Dip each cake square into the icing to coat all sides. 4. Immediately roll the iced square in desiccated coconut.

description: A hand-sized pie containing diced or minced meat and gravy, sometimes with onion, mushrooms, or cheese.
ingredients: ['Shortcrust pastry', 'Puff pastry', 'Minced beef', 'Onion', 'Beef broth', 'Gravy thickener', 'Worcestershire sauce']
preparation: 1. Make a rich meat and gravy filling. 2. Line pie tins with shortcrust pastry. 3. Fill with the cooled meat mixture. 4. Top with a puff pastry lid. 5. Bake until pastry is golden and flaky.

description: A simple but iconic Australian snack of toast spread with a thin layer of butter and Vegemite.
preparation: 1. Toast a slice of bread to your liking. 2. While hot, spread with a generous amount of butter. 3. Scrape a very thin layer of Vegemite over the butter. Do not spread it thickly.

description: A traditional New Zealand Māori method of cooking food using heated rocks buried in a pit oven.
preparation: 1. Dig a pit and heat rocks in a large fire. 2. Place food in wire baskets lined with leaves. 3. Place hot rocks in the pit, then the food baskets on top. 4. Cover with wet cloths and a mound of earth. 5. Cook for 3-4 hours.

description: A hamburger popular in New Zealand, which includes a fried egg and a slice of beetroot along with standard burger fillings.
preparation: 1. Cook the beef patty. 2. Fry an egg. 3. Assemble the burger with all ingredients, making sure to include the signature egg and beetroot.

description: A sweet biscuit, popular in Australia and New Zealand, made using rolled oats, flour, sugar, butter, golden syrup, baking soda and boiling water.
preparation: 1. Mix dry ingredients. 2. Melt butter and golden syrup. 3. Dissolve baking soda in boiling water and add to butter mixture (it will foam). 4. Mix wet and dry ingredients. 5. Roll into balls, flatten, and bake until golden.

description: A traditional ceremonial drink in Fiji, made from the root of the kava plant, with sedative and anesthetic properties.
preparation: 1. Place kava powder into a cloth straining bag. 2. Submerge the bag in a bowl of cold water. 3. Knead and squeeze the bag repeatedly for about 10-15 minutes until the water becomes opaque and brownish. 4. The resulting liquid is kava. Served in a coconut shell cup (bilo).

description: A Fijian dish of raw fish marinated in citrus juice and coconut cream.
ingredients: ['Fresh white fish (mahi-mahi)', 'Lemon or lime juice', 'Coconut cream', 'Onion', 'Chili', 'Tomato', 'Cucumber']
preparation: 1. Cube the raw fish and marinate in citrus juice until it becomes opaque. 2. Drain most of the juice. 3. Add finely diced vegetables. 4. Stir in coconut cream and season with salt. Serve chilled.

description: A popular Korean barbecue dish made from beef short ribs marinated in a sweet and savory sauce.
preparation: 1. Butterfly the beef short ribs or use thinly sliced ones. 2. Make a marinade by blending soy sauce, sugar, grated pear, garlic, ginger, and sesame oil. 3. Marinate the ribs for at least 4 hours. 4. Grill over charcoal until caramelized and cooked.

description: A small French pastry flavored with rum and vanilla with a soft and tender custard center and a dark, thick caramelized crust.
preparation: 1. Infuse milk with vanilla and butter. 2. Mix flour and sugar, then whisk in eggs. 3. Combine milk and flour mixtures, add rum. 4. Let the batter rest for 24-48 hours. 5. Pour into special copper canelé molds and bake at high heat.

description: Italian rice balls that are stuffed, coated with bread crumbs and deep fried, a staple of Sicilian cuisine.
ingredients: ['Leftover risotto', 'Mozzarella', 'Ground beef and pea filling (ragù)', 'Flour', 'Eggs', 'Breadcrumbs', 'Oil for frying']
preparation: 1. Take a scoop of cooled risotto in your palm. 2. Make an indent and fill with ragù and a cube of mozzarella. 3. Form into a ball, ensuring the filling is enclosed. 4. Coat in flour, egg, and breadcrumbs. 5. Deep-fry until golden brown.

description: A flat oven-baked Italian bread product similar in style and texture to pizza doughs.
preparation: 1. Make a high-hydration dough. 2. Let it rise, then spread it in an oiled pan. 3. Dimple the dough with your fingers, drizzle generously with olive oil. 4. Sprinkle with salt and rosemary. 5. Bake until golden brown.

description: A Spanish dessert of fried choux pastry, dusted with cinnamon sugar, and served with a thick hot chocolate for dipping.
preparation: 1. Make a choux pastry dough. 2. Pipe the dough through a star-tipped nozzle into hot oil and fry until golden. 3. Toss in cinnamon sugar. 4. Make a thick dipping chocolate by melting dark chocolate with milk and a little cornstarch.

description: A French hot sandwich made with ham and cheese, topped with béchamel sauce and more cheese, then baked or fried.
preparation: 1. Make a sandwich with bread, ham, and cheese. 2. Top with a layer of béchamel sauce and more grated cheese. 3. Bake in the oven or pan-fry until the sandwich is toasted and the cheese on top is melted and bubbly.

description: A Russian pancake traditionally made from wheat or buckwheat flour and served with sour cream, butter, and caviar.
preparation: 1. Make a yeast-leavened batter with buckwheat flour. 2. Let it rise. 3. Cook small, thin pancakes (blini) on a hot griddle. 4. Serve warm, topped with a dollop of sour cream and a small spoonful of caviar.

description: A traditional Georgian dish of cheese-filled bread. The bread is leavened and allowed to rise, and is shaped in various ways.
preparation: 1. Make a soft, enriched dough. 2. Roll it out and shape it into a boat. 3. Fill the center with a mixture of cheeses. 4. Bake until the bread is golden. 5. Crack a raw egg on top during the last few minutes of baking. Serve with a pat of butter.

description: A type of dumpling popular in most Turkic cuisines, as well as in the cuisines of the South Caucasus and Central Asia.
preparation: 1. Make a simple dough and roll it out very thin. 2. Cut into small squares. 3. Place a tiny amount of spiced meat filling in the center of each square and pinch the corners together. 4. Steam or boil the dumplings. 5. Serve topped with a garlic-yogurt sauce and a drizzle of paprika butter.

description: A Singaporean dish consisting of steamed white rice smothered in a mess of curries and braised gravy.
ingredients: ['Rice', 'Chicken curry', 'Lor bak (braised pork)', 'Chap chye (braised vegetables)', 'Fried pork chop', 'Prawn fritters']
preparation: 1. Prepare several different dishes: a Hainanese-style chicken curry, braised pork, and braised vegetables. 2. Also prepare crispy items like fried pork chop. 3. To serve, plate a scoop of rice and generously ladle all the different gravies and toppings over it.

description: A Singaporean seafood dish where mud crabs are stir-fried in a semi-thick, sweet and savory tomato and chili based sauce.
preparation: 1. Prepare and steam the crabs. 2. Sauté aromatics and chili paste. 3. Add ketchup, sugar, vinegar, and stock to create the sauce. 4. Add the crabs and simmer. 5. Thicken the sauce by stirring in a beaten egg. Serve with fried buns (mantou).

description: A popular noodle dish from Maritime Southeast Asia, made from flat rice noodles stir-fried over high heat with soy sauce, chili, shrimp, and cockles.
ingredients: ['Flat rice noodles', 'Shrimp', 'Chinese sausage', 'Bean sprouts', 'Chives', 'Eggs', 'Dark soy sauce', 'Light soy sauce']
preparation: 1. Heat a wok until smoking hot. 2. Sauté garlic, then add shrimp and sausage. 3. Add noodles and soy sauces, and stir-fry vigorously. 4. Push noodles aside, add an egg and scramble. 5. Toss everything with bean sprouts and chives.

description: A crispy, flaky Indian bread stuffed with a spiced potato filling, cooked in a tandoor.
preparation: 1. Make a soft dough. 2. Prepare a mashed potato filling with spices. 3. Stuff the dough with the filling and roll it out. 4. Traditionally cooked in a tandoor, but can be cooked on a skillet and then under a broiler. 5. Serve with a generous amount of butter or ghee.

description: An aromatic curried meat dish of Persian or Kashmiri origin. It is made with red meat, traditionally lamb or goat.
preparation: 1. Brown the meat. 2. Create a masala with onions, ginger, garlic, and powdered spices, especially Kashmiri chili for color. 3. Add yogurt and the meat. 4. Simmer slowly for a long time until the meat is tender and a layer of red oil (rogan) floats on top.

description: An Indian curry dish, originally from Goa, based on the Portuguese dish 'carne de vinha d'alhos'. It is known for being fiery hot.
preparation: 1. Make a paste by grinding chilies, garlic, ginger, and spices with vinegar. 2. Marinate pork in this paste overnight. 3. Brown the meat in a pan. 4. Add onions, potatoes, and the remaining marinade. 5. Simmer until the pork and potatoes are cooked and the sauce has thickened.

description: A spicy and sour hot soup with coconut milk in Thai cuisine.
preparation: 1. Simmer coconut milk with sliced galangal, bruised lemongrass, and lime leaves to infuse flavors. 2. Add chicken and mushrooms and cook until done. 3. Season with fish sauce and lime juice. Do not boil after adding lime juice.

description: A Northern Thai noodle soup, a coconut curry soup served with both boiled and crispy fried noodles, meat, and pickles.
ingredients: ['Egg noodles', 'Chicken drumsticks', 'Coconut milk', 'Red curry paste', 'Turmeric', 'Curry powder', 'Shallots', 'Lime', 'Pickled mustard greens']
preparation: 1. Make a curry broth with coconut milk and spices. 2. Simmer chicken drumsticks in the broth until tender. 3. Boil some egg noodles and deep-fry some for a crispy topping. 4. Serve the boiled noodles and chicken in the soup, then top with the crispy noodles and accompaniments.

description: A regional Vietnamese noodle dish from Hội An, made with special noodles, pork, and local greens.
ingredients: ['Cao lầu noodles', 'Pork loin', 'Soy sauce', 'Five-spice powder', 'Bean sprouts', 'Herbs', 'Crispy pork rind or fried noodle crackers']
preparation: 1. Marinate and braise pork. The braising liquid becomes the sauce. 2. The special noodles are prepared using water from a specific well in Hoi An. 3. Blanch noodles and bean sprouts. 4. Assemble the bowl with noodles, sliced pork, herbs, and a small amount of the concentrated broth.

description: A Japanese type of skewered chicken. Its preparation involves skewering the meat with kushi, a type of skewer made of bamboo.
preparation: 1. Cut chicken and scallions into bite-sized pieces. 2. Skewer them alternately. 3. Make a sweet soy glaze (tare) by simmering soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar. 4. Grill the skewers over charcoal, basting with the tare sauce until cooked through and caramelized.

description: Japanese pan-fried dumplings, typically filled with ground pork and vegetables.
preparation: 1. Mix pork with finely chopped vegetables and seasonings. 2. Place filling onto wrappers, moisten edges, and pleat to seal. 3. Pan-fry the dumplings until the bottoms are golden. 4. Add water to the pan, cover, and steam until cooked through.

description: A Japanese savory egg custard, steamed in a teacup-like container.
preparation: 1. Lightly beat eggs and mix with seasoned dashi stock. Strain the mixture. 2. Place ingredients like chicken, shrimp, and mushrooms in a heatproof cup. 3. Pour the egg mixture over the ingredients. 4. Steam gently until the custard is set but still wobbly.

description: A dish of Mexican cuisine originating from the state of Michoacán. Carnitas are made by braising or simmering pork in oil or preferably lard until tender.
ingredients: ['Pork shoulder (Boston butt)', 'Lard or oil', 'Orange', 'Milk', 'Cinnamon stick', 'Bay leaves', 'Salt']
preparation: 1. Cut pork into large chunks. 2. Place in a heavy pot with lard, a halved orange, milk, and spices. 3. Simmer slowly for several hours. The milk solids will help with browning. 4. Once tender, increase heat to crisp the outside. 5. Shred and serve in tacos.

description: A traditional Mexican slow-roasted pork dish from the Yucatán Peninsula. Preparation involves marinating the meat in a highly acidic citrus juice and achiote.
ingredients: ['Pork shoulder', 'Achiote paste', 'Orange juice', 'Lime juice', 'Garlic', 'Habanero peppers', 'Banana leaves']
preparation: 1. Blend achiote paste with citrus juices and spices to make a marinade. 2. Marinate the pork for several hours. 3. Wrap the pork tightly in banana leaves. 4. Slow-roast in an oven or pit for many hours until the meat is fork-tender. 5. Shred and serve with pickled red onions.

description: A traditional soup or stew from Mexican Cuisine. It is made from hominy, with meat (typically pork), and can be seasoned and garnished.
preparation: 1. Cook pork with onion and garlic until tender. 2. Rehydrate dried chiles and blend into a sauce. 3. Add the chile sauce and cooked hominy to the pork broth. 4. Simmer to meld flavors. 5. Serve in bowls and let guests add their own garnishes.

description: A sandwich made from thinly sliced pieces of beefsteak and melted cheese in a long hoagie roll.
ingredients: ['Ribeye steak (thinly sliced)', 'Hoagie roll', 'Onions', 'Provolone cheese or Cheez Whiz']
preparation: 1. Sauté thinly sliced onions until caramelized. 2. On the same griddle, cook the thinly sliced steak quickly. 3. Mix the steak and onions together. 4. Place cheese slices on top to melt. 5. Scoop the entire mixture into a split hoagie roll.

description: A pizza baked in a pan, with a high, buttery crust filled with large amounts of cheese and chunky tomato sauce.
ingredients: ['Pizza dough (with cornmeal)', 'Sliced mozzarella', 'Italian sausage', 'Chunky tomato sauce', 'Parmesan cheese']
preparation: 1. Press the dough into a deep, oiled pan, forming a high crust edge. 2. Layer the bottom with sliced mozzarella. 3. Add toppings like Italian sausage. 4. Top with a chunky, uncooked tomato sauce. 5. Sprinkle with Parmesan and bake for 30-40 minutes.

description: A spicy stew containing chili peppers, meat (usually beef), and often tomatoes and beans. True Texas chili famously contains no beans.
preparation: 1. Toast and rehydrate dried chiles, then blend into a paste. 2. Brown the cubed beef. 3. Sauté onions and garlic, then add the chile paste and spices. 4. Return beef to the pot, add broth, and simmer for several hours until the beef is very tender.

description: An American dessert pie made of Key lime juice, egg yolks, and sweetened condensed milk in a pie crust.
ingredients: ['Graham cracker crust', 'Key lime juice', 'Egg yolks', 'Sweetened condensed milk', 'Whipped cream']
preparation: 1. Prepare a graham cracker crust. 2. Whisk together egg yolks, sweetened condensed milk, and Key lime juice. 3. Pour the filling into the crust. 4. Bake for a short time until the filling is just set. 5. Chill thoroughly. Serve with whipped cream.

description: A Canadian no-bake dessert bar that consists of three layers: a wafer crumb-based crust, a custard-flavored butter icing, and a layer of melted chocolate.
preparation: 1. Make the base by melting butter and mixing with dry ingredients; press into a pan. 2. Make the middle layer by creaming butter, custard powder, milk, and icing sugar; spread over the base. 3. Melt chocolate and spread on top. 4. Chill until firm before cutting.

description: A French-Canadian meat pie, typically made with minced pork, veal or beef, and spices.
preparation: 1. Cook ground pork with onions and spices. 2. Mix with a small amount of mashed potato to bind the filling. 3. Line a pie plate with pastry, add the cooled filling, and top with another layer of pastry. 4. Crimp edges, cut vents, and bake until golden brown.
